output: Print the index of the closest string on the first line. If this value was not equal to -1, so print the value of the edit distance on the second line.
input: The first line contains the string x ( 1 ≤ len(x) ). The next line contains an integer k ( 1 ≤ k ≤ 100 ). Each one of the next 5 lines contain a string y ( len(y) ≤ 100000).
name: Six Strings
description:
The problem is simple. Given a string(x) and 5 other strings, find the string with the least edit distance with x.
					If the value of this edit distance is greater than k, print -1.
